title: Collaborative Problem-Solving Pattern Analysis: Online Collaborative Learning for Social Issue Resolution

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital communication skills and interest in understanding social issues
context.additional_context: Conducted through a combination of online synchronous collaborative learning and offline discussion sessions in a limited technological environment centered on smartphones.

learning_goals: By participating three or more times in collaborative problem-solving (CPS) processes for social issues using online chat tools, learners analyze cognitive, metacognitive, and socio-communicative patterns.
Learners classify conflict situations in CPS into two types (e.g., time-lag/asynchronous conflict, spatial/role conflict) and propose one or more suitable resolution strategies per type.
Learners understand the principles of Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) and apply its simplified form (e.g., similarity calculations on time/space axes) to visualize collaborative patterns.

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Online Chat Tool (e.g., KakaoTalk Open Chat)
Paper Worksheet for Simple Graph Construction
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
